glsa.title: jabberd 1.x: Denial of Service vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: The jabberd server was found to be vulnerable to a remote Denial of Service attack.

background.p: Jabber is a set of streaming XML protocols enabling message, presence, and other structured information exchange between two hosts. jabberd is the original implementation of the Jabber protocol server.

description.p: Jose Antonio Calvo found a defect in routines handling XML parsing of incoming data. jabberd 1.x may crash upon reception of invalid data on any socket connection on which XML is parsed.

impact.p: A remote attacker may send a specific sequence of bytes to an open socket to crash the jabberd server, resulting in a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
